title: Tea Bowl
text: Japanese monks who traveled to China returned with many foreign treasures, including temmoku tea bowls. Named after Mount Tianmu (Temmoku in Japanese) in Chekiang Province where many Japanese monks received Zen training, these bowls were distinguished by their conical shape, small foot, and lustrous black glaze. Highly prized as rare imported objects, temmoku tea bowls were always used in conjunction with a lacquered stand.
description: stoneware; unglazed foot, lower body and rim; \'hare\'s fur\' glaze
creditline: Gift of Dr. and Mrs. Donald E. Lee
